Gross.definition: flagrant or extreme esp. in badness or offensiveness
Gross.origin: [Middle English, immediately obvious, from Middle French gros thick, coarse, from Latin grossus ]

1.definition: flagrant or extreme esp. in badness or offensivenessof very blameworthy character [a violation of the rules of ethics] [a abuse of trust]

2.definition: consisting of an overall total exclusive of deductions [ annual earnings] compare

in gross1:as a lump sum see alsolump sum.definition: vtto earn or bring in (an overall total) exclusive of deductions (as for taxes or expenses)
